responses.content:
```yaml
leads:
  - headline: Insecure default session cookie configuration
    analysis: |
      The code sets the default `sameSite` attribute of the session cookie to `null`, which results in the less secure `Lax` behavior.
      `Lax` allows the session cookie to be sent in cross-site requests, for example when a user clicks on a link from a malicious website.
      This can lead to cross-site request forgery (CSRF) attacks, where the attacker can trick the user into performing actions on the website without their knowledge.
      
      To mitigate this, set the `sameSite` attribute to `Strict` in the default session cookie configuration.
    cwe: CWE-352
    function_names:
      - ensureDefaults
    filenames:
      - lib/fastifySession.js
    classification: slightly promising
```

leads.headline: Insecure default session cookie configuration
leads.analysis:
The code sets the default sameSite attribute of the session cookie to null, which results in the less secure Lax behavior.
Lax allows the session cookie to be sent in cross-site requests, for example when a user clicks on a link from a malicious website.
This can lead to cross-site request forgery (CSRF) attacks, where the attacker can trick the user into performing actions on the website without their knowledge.

To mitigate this, set the sameSite attribute to Strict in the default session cookie configuration.
